title: Tabs that I can't close
content:
Hi! I'm going nuts. I have Firefox set to NOT remember sessions when I close and re-open. But every time I re-open the (latest) Firefox on my (up to date) Mac, 3 tabs reappear. It doesn't matter how often I delete history or cookies or empty caches. They are not even 3 tabs from the most recent session! They are from a week ago. And no, they are not pinned tabs!

And yes, I have reinstalled Firefox.

Any idea what I should do?

Many thanks!

David
creator: davidderrick

title: firefox blocks access to the internet
content:
I installed instantWP on a USB-stick. When I try (for the first time) to open the dashboard of it, Firefox says (my translation from Dutch): This address has limited access. I searched already for a long time on the internet and I found that in about:config I have to add a line: netwerk.security.ports.banned.override. I have to enter a number of which I have read that it must be 6000. But it doesn't work. Firefox gives me no indication of what should be the correct number.

Can you help me ?

Kindest regards, Nagels Ludo

creator: haeschke

title: Can't open web links on some sites, unless I right-click and "open in new tab"
content:
I've started having a strange issue with both Firefox for Windows and Android. On some news websites, and sports websites, I can no longer open articles just by clicking on them, but right-clicking works. If this sounds strange - it is!

The issue is exactly as it sounds like. I can hower the mouse over the title of an article and Firefox will recognize that it's a link, showing me the path at the very bottom left of the browser. But when I click it, it simply won't do anything. My mouse works fine before you ask. It's only when I right-click the same article and choose "open in new tab" that the article opens. This is happening on some major sites as well, like the BBC.

At first I thought this was Windows-specific, but I have also had the same issues with my Firefox for Android. And again, long-pressing on the article and selecting open in new tab will open the link, but not normal tapping.

I have restared Firefox in Troubleshooting mode to disable any addons but the problems persist.

Anyone else having the same issue or is there a known solution?
creator: nucnik

title: Secure connection failed
content:
I am trying to do a Firefox update and keep getting the same error. The website does not help as it does not tell me how to fix it:

Secure Connection Failed

The connection to the server was reset while the page was loading. 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

Learn more…

By clicking on "Learn More" it only tells me the problem, not the solution.

title: Firefox Primary Password Prompt Delay
content:
Hi, i'm using Firefox Sync and therefore FF asks for primary password on every startup. The delay until it asks for the password is annoying. e.g. already typing into my favorite search engine when i look up and see the seach term is typed into the password field because of the delayed, random popup.

I know there's a workaroud to pin Firefox Account site to speed things up, but this is a bad workaround. Why isn't it possible to change FF to ask for the password immediately when Sync is enabled. Can't be this hard.

P.S. Why isn't Chrome asking ever for a password, even if Sync and PW are stored?

pappl

title: Secure Connection Failed when accessing Microsoft Sharepoint
content:
Hello Firefox community. I'm trying to switch over to Firefox from Chrome but I'm encountering issues when it comes to getting Sharepoint from MS Office 365 to work on Firefox. Word, Exel, Outlook, Teams, and One Drive work fine. When it comes to Sharepoint, Firefox gives me a Secure Connection Failed message. Sharepoint works fine on Chrome, Safari, and Edge. Is there a setting I need to change on the Firefox browser that allows me to use Sharepoint cloud without it telling me?

Thanks in advance for all advice and assistance.

title: Can't copy/paste images into Facebook comments
content:
I emptied cache & then reset FIREFOX (lost all add-ons) and still cannot paste images into comments on Facebook. The cursor blinks and nothing happens. Size, format, of image doesn't matter.

I can paste into status & every other computer application. (Twitter, Word, all others)

FB will accept paste of text & links in comments but not images unless saved to computer first.

I can paste from my screen grab application (PicPick which is excellent & better than the WIN 10 snip n sketch)

I can paste images in comments in MS Edge but I don't like using that browser as it does not have as many good add-ons.
creator: JoliePrincesskatana
